text.tspan: error: "too many requests, try again later"

line.style: fill: none; stroke-opacity: 1; stroke-width: 3; stroke-dasharray: 4; stroke: #000000

text.tspan: Too many requests: >10 for that IP,UserAgent combo, >30 for that IP within the last 10 mins
invalid guess, not too many requests
we let them try again on the same captcha
too many attempts on this hint/is stale
ask the client to request a new captcha

line.style: fill: none; stroke-opacity: 1; stroke-width: 3; stroke-dasharray: 4; stroke: #000000
fill: none; stroke-opacity: 1; stroke-width: 3; stroke-dasharray: 4; stroke: #000000

text.tspan: XXX: at this point, the user will probably request another captcha?
email is used to allow comment deletion.
a user is able to request deletion of a post
if they provided the correct email for that id,
then, we send a magic link to them that deletes it

line.style: fill: none; stroke-opacity: 1; stroke-width: 3; stroke-dasharray: 4; stroke: #000000

text.tspan: we send that user an email, with the following link
note, that the deltoken is a fullstop separated string:
we use the id to avoid timing attacks in the DB
commentid: the comment that you just posted
client probably will see if there's new comments
(lol are you implying its gonna be that active)
if ID hasn't been seen, just return all results
Note: updated the 201 statuses to 200 - a compliant REST interface should return the object in the header, which
doesn't seem doable for something like captcha requesting. like what's the point, hence the change to a 200
didn't provide the post data/or its missing required fields
